Package int3.team2.website.pantry_loogr.presentation

Class RecipeController

java.lang.Object
int3.team2.website.pantry_loogr.presentation.RecipeController
@Controller @RequestMapping("/recipes") public class RecipeController extends Object
Allows the user to see all teh recipes, he can add them to his favourites, or he can indicate that he wants to cook one and the ingredients that he needs for it will be added to his shopping list

    • createRecipe

      @RequestMapping(value="/createrecipe", method=POST, consumes="application/x-www-form-urlencoded") public String createRecipe(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession, @RequestBody org.springframework.util.MultiValueMap<String,String> recipeData)
      fetches the information of the created recipe and adds it to the DB through the recipe service
      Returns:
      redirects the user to the recipe page

    • recommendations

      @GetMapping("/recommend") public String recommendations(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Fetches all the ingredients that have been entered a week ago or more (these are likely to be expiring soon) and fetches all the recipes that contain these ingredients. If there are no Ingredients about to expire, fetches all the recipes that contain ingredients that the user has. It then filters the recipes based on the user's preferences and sorts them (first is the most likely to be at the user's taste). Lastly, it looks which ingredient the user already has and which he needs for the recipe

    • getRecipeByName

      @GetMapping("/search/{name}") public String getRecipeByName(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession, org.springframework.ui.Model model, @PathVariable String name)

    • selectRecipe

      @GetMapping("/select-current/{recipeId}") public String selectRecipe(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession httpSession, @PathVariable int recipeId)
      The User can select a recipe to cook, it will then add all the ingredients he doesn't have and adds them to his shopping list, it then redirects him to it
